H0.text: From 1937 to 1942 Alan Lomax, who contributed more than 10,000 field recordings of folk music from the USA, the Caribbean, Ireland, Great Britain, Spain, and Italy, was Assistant in Charge of the Archive of Folk Song of what establishment. The Smithsonian Institution

H3.text: From 1937 to 1942 Alan Lomax, who contributed more than 10,000 field recordings of folk music from the USA, the Caribbean, Ireland, Great Britain, Spain, and Italy, was Assistant in Charge of the Archive of Folk Song of what establishment. Loc.gov

A4.text: From 1937 to 1942, Lomax was Assistant in Charge of the Archive of Folk Song of the Library of Congress

A5.text: The Alan Lomax Collection is housed at the Library of Congress
